alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Coastal Wakulla; Gadsden; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 11:46AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Gulf, western Wakulla, southeastern Gadsden, southern Liberty, Leon and northwestern Franklin Counties through 1245 PM EST/1145 AM CST/... At 1146 AM EST/1046 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Florida A And M to 9 miles east of Port St. Joe. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Woodville, Tallahassee, Crawfordville, Midway, Port St. Joe, Florida State University, Florida A And M, Tallahassee Comm College, Doak Campbell Stadium, Sopchoppy, Lake Bradford, Jewel Fire Tower, Shadeville, Leon Sinks, Gaither Community Center, Wakulla Springs, Tallahassee Memorial Hosp, Central City, Eight Mile Pond and Beverly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
